summary: A "commission agent" is a legal entity or individual engaged in distributive trades within the European Union, acting on behalf of another party to facilitate transactions. This role involves negotiating sales or purchases, where the agent earns a commission based on the value of the transactions completed. In the context of EU regulatory frameworks, commission agents must adhere to specific legal obligations, including transparency in their dealings and compliance with consumer protection laws. Their activities are governed by various directives aimed at ensuring fair competition and safeguarding the interests of both consumers and businesses in the internal market.
